A war hawk, or simply hawk, is a term used in politics for someone favoring war in 
a debate over whether to go to war, or whether to continue or escalate an existing 
war. War hawks are the opposite of doves. The terms are derived by analogy with 
the birds of the same name: hawks ... Randolph of Roanoke, a staunch opponent 
of entry into the War of 1812.
